properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Advisory issued February 14 at 3:49PM EST until February 15 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Moderate beach and dune erosion and lakeshore flooding
expected.

* WHERE...Ottawa, Allegan and Van Buren counties.

* WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 PM EST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Moderate erosion of beaches and dunes is expected.
Inundation of low-lying areas along the lakeshore, in river
mouths and road closures are possible.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong southwest winds on Saturday of 20-30
mph with gusts over 40 mph will create large waves. The waves
will likely peak around midday Saturday in the 6 to 10 foot
range. The waves on top of a push of water associated with the
wind will result in significant beach and dune erosion. Flooding
of low lying areas is possible, including back into river
channels.
properties.instruction:
A Lakeshore Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds will
generate some flooding of low areas along the lakeshore. Some
moderate beach and dune erosion is also likely.

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY
